results.idea: Cross-model spread: hedge minus linear score
results.description: Combine hedge and linear model scores to capture divergences. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using two datafields (oth335_hc_combined_all_region_hedge, oth335_combined_all_region_linear). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). Coverage <0.6 so applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill on both. Preferred high userCount fields (hedge userCount=330, linear userCount=256) per SUGGESTION4. Kept implementation short per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence: 0.65 because two independent models can produce robust spread signals but still model risk exists.

Time-series momentum on final MIND score (oth335_combined_all_region_mind). Applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill for coverage. SUGGESTION1 used single high-alphaCount field (alphaCount=363). SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Matches KEEP_IN_MIND constraints. Confidence: 0.6 — MIND is composite and tends to be persistent.

Mean-reversion on short horizon for SHIELD score (oth335_combined_all_region_shield). Applied ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Chose this field despite lower userCount because it offers orthogonal signal. SUGGESTION1 minimal (single field). SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.5 — short-term reversal plausible but noisy.

Rank/normalize linear model scores cross-sectionally (oth335_combined_all_region_linear). Applied ts_backfill for coverage and then zscore for cross-sectional alpha. SUGGESTION1 partially applied (single field), SUGGESTION4 chosen due to high alphaCount. Confidence: 0.62 — cross-sectional ranks tend to be stable.

Long names where hedge outperforms SHIELD (divergence of two scores). Applied ts_backfill to both (SUGGESTION3). Used two complementary models per SUGGESTION1. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence: 0.6 — model vs model spread can capture idiosyncratic signals.

Use ts_ir to find securities with stable high MIND signal (oth335_combined_all_region_mind). Applied ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) then ts_ir. SUGGESTION1 single field applied; SUGGESTION4 respected (high alphaCount). Confidence: 0.66 — stability filter tends to improve hit-rate.

Downweight large caps by dividing SHIELD by MKT cap to favor small-cap positive SHIELD anomalies. Applied ts_backfill to both fields. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION4 noted mktcap has lower userCount but is necessary. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.55 — size tilt can help but mktcap data here has low coverage.

Short-term rank of hedge score to capture recent momentum (oth335_hc_combined_all_region_hedge). Applied ts_backfill and then ts_rank. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION4 used high userCount hedge field. Confidence: 0.61 — short-term ranks reasonable for trading.

results.idea: Cross-model consensus: average of hedge, linear, SHIELD
results.description: Aggregate multiple model scores to reduce idiosyncratic noise. Applied SUGGESTION1 combining three sources but kept to 2 datafields limit by composing two then adding third requires >2 datafields — to satisfy KEEP_IN_MIND2 we instead average hedge and linear as proxy. SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill to both. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence: 0.63 — combining models improves robustness; used two strongest fields.

Cross-sectional zscore on the hc MIND field to capture reversions (oth335_hc_combined_all_region_mind). Applied ts_backfill then zscore. SUGGESTION4 used hc field because of decent userCount. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.58 — moderate expectation of mean reversion.

results.idea: Short-term breakout via ts_arg_max on linear
results.description: Identify securities at local highs in linear score (oth335_combined_all_region_linear) using ts_arg_max to capture breakouts. Applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.56 — breakout signals plausible but can be noisy.

Multiply momentum (ts_zscore) by stability (ts_ir) for MIND to upweight persistent movers. Both operators applied after ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Single-field per KEEP_IN_MIND2. SUGGESTION4 used higher alphaCount MIND. Confidence: 0.68 — combining strength and stability improves signal quality.

results.idea: Hedge minus hc-MIND for risk-adjusted divergence
results.description: Spread between hedge score and hc-MIND to find idiosyncratic opportunities. Applied ts_backfill to both. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION4 prioritized hedge high userCount. Confidence: 0.6 — divergence between related models can be predictive.

Prefer securities with low recent volatility in SHIELD (oth335_combined_all_region_shield) to favor stable positive signals. Applied ts_backfill then ts_std_dev. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.54 — stability helps but reduces turnover.

results.idea: Negative information ratio: short unstable MIND
results.description: Short names with low ts_ir on MIND (unstable signals). Applied ts_backfill then ts_ir and reversed sign. SUGGESTION3 used ts_backfill. SUGGESTION4 favored MIND. Confidence: 0.52 — shorting unstable signals is plausible but riskier.

results.idea: Cross-field correlation filter: low correlation between hedge and linear
results.description: Find instruments where hedge and linear scores are decoupled (low ts_corr) to target unique signals. Applied ts_backfill then ts_corr. SUGGESTION1 used both fields; SUGGESTION4 chosen for high counts. Confidence: 0.59 — low correlation identifies special situations.

results.idea: Short-term accumulation: ts_sum of positive SHIELD returns
results.description: Aggregate recent positive SHIELD moves via ts_sum to find accumulating momentum. Applied ts_backfill then ts_sum. SUGGESTION2 irrelevant. Confidence: 0.57 — aggregated short-term moves often continue.

Time-scale normalize linear scores with ts_scale to compare across time. Applied ts_backfill then ts_scale. SUGGESTION4 used linear high alphaCount. Confidence: 0.6 — scaled signals easier to combine across securities.

results.idea: Mean rank of hedge over month
results.description: Cross-sectional rank of monthly hedge ts_mean to find sustained leadership. Applied ts_backfill then ts_mean + zscore. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.62 — sustained leaders often continue.
Reward strong MIND zscore but penalize recent volatility (ts_std_dev). Applied ts_backfill to MIND. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.67 — risk-adjusted momentum typically improves returns.

ts_returns of hedge over 60 days to capture multi-month strength. Applied ts_backfill then ts_returns. SUGGESTION4 chosen hedge for userCount. Confidence: 0.6 — multi-month returns are predictive but noisy.

Identify assets with high ts_kurtosis in linear score (oth335_combined_all_region_linear) to target fat-tailed behavior. Applied ts_backfill then ts_kurtosis. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.48 — kurtosis signals rare events; lower confidence.

Normalize SHIELD across universe using normalize(ts_backfill). Applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3 then normalize. SUGGESTION4 lower userCount for SHIELD noted but still useful. Confidence: 0.56 — normalization improves comparability.

results.idea: Pair-trade: hedge vs shield momentum spread
results.description: Long names where hedge momentum >> SHIELD momentum. Applied ts_backfill to both, used ts_zscore momentum and subtract. SUGGESTION1 used two complementary fields. Confidence: 0.61 — momentum spread can capture model disagreement.

Apply ts_backfill aggressively to address coverage (~0.46) on linear then use ts_backfill k=1 via kth_element for extra robustness. SUGGESTION3 applied; SUGGESTION1 single field due to KEEP_IN_MIND2. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.5 — backfill helps but can introduce stale values.

Cross-sectional zscore of hc hedge after backfill to get relative ranking. Applied ts_backfill and zscore. SUGGESTION4 used high-userCount hc hedge. Confidence: 0.63 — ranking robust across cross-section.
Find securities where MIND hits new recent highs using ts_arg_max. Applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.58 — breakouts have asymmetric returns.

Divide hedge zscore by its recent ts_std_dev to favor stable strong hedges. Applied ts_backfill then zscore and ts_std_dev. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.65 — stability weighting improves signal-to-noise.

Trade against extreme linear scores (mean-reversion). Applied ts_backfill then zscore and reverse. SUGGESTION1 single field; SUGGESTION4 used because linear has high alphaCount. Confidence: 0.55 — contrarian tends to work short-term.

results.idea: TS decay on MIND to reduce turnover
results.description: Apply ts_decay_linear to recent MIND signal to smooth positions; used ts_backfill before decay. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.6 — decay reduces turnover and may improve net returns.
Bucket hedge scores into quintiles after backfill to create discrete long/short buckets. Applied ts_backfill then bucket. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.59 — bucketing helps risk control.

Multiply inverse market cap with negative linear zscore to short large weak names. Applied ts_backfill to both fields; used inverse on mktcap. SUGGESTION4 noted mktcap low userCount but necessary. Confidence: 0.53 — size tilt increases tail risk.
Divide SHIELD zscore by its recent ts_std_dev to emphasize stable SHIELD signals. Applied ts_backfill and standard operators. Confidence: 0.56 — reduces noise.

results.idea: High-confidence consensus: average hc-hedge and hc-MIND
results.description: Average two HC fields to find consistent signals in hc universe. Applied ts_backfill to both. SUGGESTION4 used hc fields due to high userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND2 respected. Confidence: 0.67 — combining two HC signals increases conviction.

results.idea: TS product of short-term increases in SHIELD and linear
results.description: Multiply short-term ts_returns of SHIELD and linear to find reinforcing momentum. Applied ts_backfill to both then ts_returns and multiply. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.6 — joint momentum increases odds of continuation.
Winsorize hedge after backfill then zscore to reduce outliers. Applied ts_backfill then winsorize and zscore. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.61 — outlier control improves stability.

results.idea: Mean rank difference: linear minus MIND
results.description: Cross-sectional rank difference between linear and MIND to find model disagreement. Applied ts_backfill to both and subtract ranks. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.58 — rank divergence often indicates alpha.

Normalize hedge scores to remove mean; group operators require GROUP field which we don't have so we limit to normalize after backfill per KEEP_IN_MIND4. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.55 — normalization necessary for cross-sectional strategies.
Short-window ts_rank of SHIELD to capture immediate breakouts. Applied ts_backfill then ts_rank. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.57 — short-window breakout has moderate predictability.

results.idea: HC-linear stability: ts_ir of hc linear (if available)
results.description: Use ts_ir to find stable hc-linear signals. Data field oth335_hc_combined_all_region_linear exists but has lower userCount; applied ts_backfill then ts_ir. SUGGESTION4 considered but still used field for diversity. Confidence: 0.5 — lower confidence due to smaller userCount.

results.idea: Relative momentum: MIND zscore minus hedge zscore
results.description: Find names where MIND momentum outpaces hedge momentum via subtracting zscores. Applied ts_backfill to both. SUGGESTION1 used both. Confidence: 0.6 — cross-signal outperformance indicates opportunity.

results.idea: Momentum persistence using ts_count_nans as liquidity proxy
results.description: Use ts_count_nans on MIND to detect illiquidity/staleness and penalize persistent NaNs. Applied ts_backfill then ts_count_nans. SUGGESTION1 single field. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence: 0.47 — NaN counts are indirect and lower confidence.

results.idea: High ts_product between hedge and linear to capture joint strength
results.description: Compute ts_product of recent values of hedge and linear after backfill to find co-moving strength. Applied ts_backfill to both then ts_product. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.59 — joint strong signals are promising.

results.idea: Rapid change detector: last_diff_value on linear
results.description: Detect recent changes in linear by last_diff_value after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.52 — detects regime shifts but can be noisy.
Use ts_scale to compress hedge scores into 0-1 range after backfill for stable weighting. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.58 — scaling makes portfolio construction easier.

results.idea: TS arg_min on SHIELD to short extreme recent lows
results.description: Short names where SHIELD is at recent minima using ts_arg_min after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.53 — bottoms often mean revert but can also trend.

Winsorize recent hedge returns to reduce outlier influence then take ts_zscore. Applied ts_backfill then ts_returns then winsorize and ts_zscore (kept operators <=7). SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.6 — robust momentum approach.

Difference between regional linear and hc-linear to detect population-specific signals. Applied ts_backfill to both. SUGGESTION4 noted lower userCount for hc-linear but divergence is informative. Confidence: 0.54 — moderate evidence.

results.idea: Normalize MIND then apply tail filter to cap extremes
results.description: Normalize backfilled MIND cross-sectionally then cap extremes via tail operator to reduce extreme weights. SUGGESTION3 applied. KEEP_IN_MIND operator count respected. Confidence: 0.59 — improves robustness.

results.idea: Hedge ts_max_diff to find recent dips below max
results.description: Use ts_max_diff on hedge to find names that declined from recent peaks (mean-reversion candidates). Applied ts_backfill then ts_max_diff. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.57 — pullbacks often revert.

results.idea: Linear ts_rank + winsorize for robust selection
results.description: Rank linear signal then winsorize to limit outliers after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.58 — combining operators enhances stability.

Favor small-cap hc-MIND leaders by dividing hc-MIND by mktcap (both backfilled). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION4 noted small userCount for mktcap but necessary; SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.52 — size tilt increases risk but can add alpha.

Convert recent SHIELD time-series into quantiles to detect outliers. Applied ts_backfill then ts_quantile. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Confidence: 0.55 — quantiles are robust to distributional changes.

results.idea: Hedge ts_rank momentum with hump to reduce turnover
results.description: Apply ts_rank on hedge then hump to limit turnover. Applied ts_backfill then ts_rank and hump. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence: 0.6 — turnover control helps net returns.

Upsize small-cap strong linear names by multiplying linear zscore with inverse mktcap after backfill. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION4 noted mktcap low userCount but used for size tilt. Confidence: 0.54 — small-cap tilt increases returns but also risk.

Absolute difference between hedge and linear scores to find high disagreement (alpha opportunities). Applied ts_backfill to both per SUGGESTION3. SUGGESTION1 two fields. Confidence: 0.58 — high disagreement often precedes moves.

results.idea: Momentum tail filter: keep only extremes in MIND
results.description: Keep extreme MIND zscores (tail operator) to focus on strong signals after backfill. Applied ts_backfill then zscore and tail. Confidence: 0.6 — focusing on extremes increases edge.

Use ts_av_diff to remove recent mean from hedge, highlighting deviations. Applied ts_backfill then ts_av_diff. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.56 — de-meaning highlights temporary mispricings.

results.idea: Linear ts_scale then quantile for uniform weighting
results.description: Scale linear scores in time then convert to quantile to ensure uniform exposure. Applied ts_backfill then ts_scale then quantile. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.59 — normalization improves portfolio construction.

results.idea: MIND ts_product with hedge to amplify consistent signals
results.description: Multiply backfilled MIND and hedge to emphasize names where both models agree positively. Applied ts_backfill to both and multiply. SUGGESTION1 used two fields per guidance. Confidence: 0.64 — agreement across models raises conviction.

results.idea: Short-term reversal using ts_arg_min on linear
results.description: Buy when linear hits recent minima (ts_arg_min) after backfill. Applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Confidence: 0.53 — reasonable short-term mean reversion strategy.

Rank difference of hedge and SHIELD to highlight model inconsistencies. Applied ts_backfill to both then ts_rank and subtract. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.58 — comparative ranks isolate relative strength.
Identify linear recent peaks with ts_arg_max after backfill to capture breakout continuation. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.56 — peaks often lead to momentum continuation.

Compute ts_ir on hc-hedge after backfill and winsorize to avoid extremes. Applied ts_backfill then ts_ir and winsorize. SUGGESTION4 used hc field for higher counts. Confidence: 0.62 — stable, winsorized IR is robust.

Use ts_regression of linear explained by hedge to find names where linear is sensitive to hedge model; applied ts_backfill to both and ts_regression. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.6 — regression beta identifies coupling.

results.idea: MIND quantile weighted by inverse mktcap
results.description: Use MIND quantile and tilt towards small cap via inverse mktcap after backfill. Applied ts_backfill to both fields. SUGGESTION4 noted mktcap low userCount but kept for size tilt. Confidence: 0.55 — size tilt increases expected return with risk.

Use ts_av_diff to get deviation from mean then zscore cross-sectionally to rank anomalies on hedge after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.61 — combines time and cross-sectional adjustments.
Flag assets with long periods since linear changed; backfill then days_from_last_change. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence: 0.49 — low confidence but can find stagnant/stable names.

results.idea: SHIELD zscore * negative ts_std_dev to favor strong stable signals
results.description: Multiply SHIELD zscore by inverse volatility (1/ts_std_dev) after backfill to favor strong stable signals. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.6 — risk-adjusted signal often better.
Add hedge and linear after backfill, winsorize then zscore to form consensus. SUGGESTION1 combined two fields, SUGGESTION3 backfilled both. Confidence: 0.65 — consensus reduces idiosyncratic noise.
Apply ts_decay_linear to MIND after backfill to emphasize recent information while smoothing. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.6 — decay balances recency and stability.
Compute quantile of linear after backfill and trade only top quantiles. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.58 — quantile filtering is robust.

results.idea: Hedge ts_product of recent returns and ts_ir
results.description: Multiply short-term hedge returns with ts_ir to favor high-return, stable names after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.63 — combining return and stability increases odds.

results.idea: Mean-reversion on consensus gap: abs(MIND - linear)
results.description: Target large absolute gaps between MIND and linear after backfill as mean-reversion candidates. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.59 — large model gaps often mean reversion opportunities.

results.idea: Short-term ts_rank of product of hedge and SHIELD
results.description: Multiply hedge and SHIELD after backfill then short-window ts_rank to pick joint momentum names. SUGGESTION1 two fields. Confidence: 0.6 — joint momentum is predictive.
Normalize linear by its volatility to get risk-adjusted signals after backfill. Applied winsorize then divide by ts_std_dev. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.61 — volatility adjustment useful.
Use ts_arg_max on hc-MIND to find recently peaked hc names after backfill. SUGGESTION4 used hc field. Confidence: 0.55 — peak persistence moderate.
Short extreme positive SHIELD zscores (reverse) after backfill to capture mean-reversion. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.54 — reversal sometimes reliable but noisy.
Use ts_max_diff to find names that dropped from highs in linear; mean-revert candidates after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.56 — pullbacks often revert.
Compute ts_covariance between hedge and linear to find changing relationships; after backfill. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.58 — changing covariance can reveal regime shifts.
Winsorize MIND after backfill then ts_zscore for robust cross-sectional ranking. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.6 — robust ranking improves selection.

results.idea: Linear product with inverse mktcap for small-cap momentum
results.description: Multiply linear zscore with inverse mktcap (both backfilled) to emphasize small-cap winners. SUGGESTION4 noted limited mktcap coverage. Confidence: 0.52 — size tilt increases expected return but also risk.

results.idea: TS rolling mean difference: hedge - ts_mean(hedge)
results.description: Compute deviation from recent mean for hedge (ts_backfill then subtract ts_mean) to find deviations. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.57 — deviations often mean-revert.

Regress linear on hc-hedge and take residual via ts_regression (rettype to get residual) after backfill to isolate idiosyncratic linear signal. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence: 0.6 — residuals often contain alpha.
Use ts_quantile on MIND with uniform driver to get evenly distributed signals after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.59 — uniform driver helpful for portfolio balancing.

results.idea: Hedge short-term product with negative ts_arg_min (momentum reversal)
results.description: Multiply recent hedge returns with indicator of recent minima to capture reversals. Implemented with ts_returns and ts_arg_min after backfill. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.53 — mixed evidence.

results.idea: Consensus zscore: average zscore of hedge and linear
results.description: Compute zscore of each model after backfill then average to form consensus. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION4 favored high-user fields. Confidence: 0.66 — averaged zscores reduce noise.
Demean MIND via ts_av_diff then convert to quantile for robust ranking after backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.6 — combined time and cross-sectional processing adds robustness.

results.idea: Linear sudden positive jump detector using last_diff_value
results.description: Use last_diff_value on linear after backfill to detect recent jumps from previous value. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.51 — jump detection useful but noisy.

results.idea: Hedge winsorized divide by group proxy (not available) — fallback normalize
results.description: Wanted group neutralization but GROUP fields are not provided (KEEP_IN_MIND4), so normalized backfilled hedge instead. SUGGESTION3 applied. SUGGESTION1 partially applied. Confidence: 0.56 — normalization is a reasonable fallback.
